'Welcome to Europe's next desert': Sicily faces a barrage of climate disasters
subhead: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (4/6). Sudden floods, rising sea levels, devastating droughts, wildfires… Climate disasters have combined on this island of five million people. Its residents want to believe they will adapt.

Bermuda braces for Hurricane Melissa after megastorm kills dozens in Caribbean
subhead: Hurricane Melissa tied the 1935 record for the most intense storm ever to make landfall when it slammed Jamaica on Tuesday, according to the US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.

title: In Canada, Marineland threatens to euthanize its beluga whales
subhead: Closed to the public for a year and heavily in debt, the aquatic park has unsuccessfully requested emergency funding from the federal government to continue caring for its 30 remaining beluga whales.

title: At the Musée d'Orsay, painter Bridget Riley from Neo-Impressionism to abstraction
subhead: A thought-provoking exhibition explores how the British artist incorporated Seurat's compositions into her own artistic investigations.

title: Egypt opens Grand Egyptian Museum, centerpiece of its tourism industry
subhead: The colossal project dates back to the 1990s. The huge site, next to the pyramids of Giza, is billed as the largest museum in the world dedicated to a single civilization. It opens on November 1 after years of delays.

'Airbnb has shaped the idea that everything can be monetized. It's a logic of constant optimization'
subhead: 'The Airbnb Ogre' (2/6). In Paris, about one-third of the listings available on Airbnb have been removed from the 'permanent' housing market, which contributes to the housing crisis in the French capital, explains researcher Jeanne Richon in an interview with Le Monde.

title: Jacques-Louis David, at home in the Louvre
subhead: The exhibition at the Paris museum brings together around a hundred works, paintings and drawings, including some on loan from Brussels, where the artist sought refuge after the Bourbon Restoration.

title: 'You can see poverty spreading': France's welfare services confront growing hardship
subhead: Around France, agents of the CAF, a government body that provides welfare benefits, deal with difficult situations as social precarity increases.
